verification./verify email@wisc.edu fullName: Starts verification process to access server features, must have valid @wisc.edu email (i.e: /verify jSmith@wisc.edu John Smith)
verification./whois UserName#0000: Returns the email address and name of the specified verified discord user. Only accessible to Board Members, Game Officers, and Mods
verification./manualverify @User email@wisc.edu full_: Manually verifies the user with the information provided. Only accessible to Board Members, Game Officers, and Mods
verification./unverify user UserName#0000: Manually deletes a user's verification record. Only accessible to Board Members, Game Officers, and Mods
verification./unverify email email@wisc.edu: Manually deletes any verification record containing the specified email (freeing it to be reused). Only accessible to Board Members, Game Officers, and Mods

settings.!setwelcomemsg [message]: Sets the bot message for when someone joins the server. Type %s where you want the user to be mentioned, or leave message blank to set to default (Requires `Manage Server` permission)
settings.!enablewelcomemsg (True/False): Enables or disables the welcome message when someone joins server (Requires `Manage Server` permission)
settings.!welcomepicture [url]: Sets the welcome message picture/gif. Leave url blank to revert to default (Requires `Manage Server` permission)
settings.!setwelcomechannel (channel): Sets the channel that you want user join messages set to. (Requires `Manage Server` permission)
settings.!setleavemsg [message]: Sets the bot message for when someone leaves the server. Type %s where you want the user to be mentioned, or leave message blank to set to default (Requires `Manage Server` permission)
settings.!enableleavemsg (True/False): Enables or disables the leave message when someone leaves server (Requires `Manage Server` permission)
settings.!leavepicture [url]: Sets the leave message picture/gif. Leave url blank to revert to default (Requires `Manage Server` permission)
settings.!setleavechannel (channel): Sets the channel that you want user leave messages set to. (Requires `Manage Server` permission)

website./createevent [name] [location] [calendar: Creates a new event on the website calendar with the specified name, location, and date/time. Game can be any of the 10 games or General
website./changeinhouse: Opens a model that allows a game officer to create a recurring inhouse event on the website calendar
website./deleteevent [calendar]: Opens a model that allows a user to delete an existing (future) event from the corresponding calendar
